summary.long: Habakkuk is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The oracle which Habakkuk the prophet saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long, O Lord, will I call for help,
And You will not hear?
I cry out to You, “Violence!”
Yet You do not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You make me see iniquity,
And cause me to look on wickedness?
Yes, destruction and violence are before me;
Strife exists and contention arises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the law is ignored
And justice is never upheld.
For the wicked surround the righteous;
Therefore justice comes out perverted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look among the nations! Observe!
Be astonished! Wonder!
Because I am doing something in your days—
You would not believe if you were told.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans,
That fierce and impetuous people
Who march throughout the earth
To seize dwelling places which are not theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They are dreaded and feared;
Their justice and authority originate with themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Their horses are swifter than leopards
And keener than wolves in the evening.
Their horsemen come galloping,
Their horsemen come from afar;
They fly like an eagle swooping down to devour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“All of them come for violence.
Their horde of faces moves forward.
They collect captives like sand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“They mock at kings
And rulers are a laughing matter to them.
They laugh at every fortress
And heap up rubble to capture it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then they will sweep through like the wind and pass on.
But they will be held guilty,
They whose strength is their god.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are You not from everlasting,
O Lord, my God, my Holy One?
We will not die.
You, O Lord, have appointed them to judge;
And You, O Rock, have established them to correct.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your eyes are too pure to approve evil,
And You can not look on wickedness with favor.
Why do You look with favor
On those who deal treacherously?
Why are You silent when the wicked swallow up
Those more righteous than they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why have You made men like the fish of the sea,
Like creeping things without a ruler over them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Chaldeans bring all of them up with a hook,
Drag them away with their net,
And gather them together in their fishing net.
Therefore they rejoice and are glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they offer a sacrifice to their net
And burn incense to their fishing net;
Because through these things their catch is large,
And their food is plentiful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will they therefore empty their net
And continually slay nations without sparing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will stand on my guard post
And station myself on the rampart;
And I will keep watch to see what He will speak to me,
And how I may reply when I am reproved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord answered me and said,
“Record the vision
And inscribe it on tablets,
That the one who reads it may run.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Furthermore, wine betrays the haughty man,
So that he does not stay at home.
He enlarges his appetite like Sheol,
And he is like death, never satisfied.
He also gathers to himself all nations
And collects to himself all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will not all of these take up a taunt-song against him,
Even mockery and insinuations against him
And say, ‘Woe to him who increases what is not his—
For how long—
And makes himself rich with loans?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will not your creditors rise up suddenly,
And those who collect from you awaken?
Indeed, you will become plunder for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Because you have looted many nations,
All the remainder of the peoples will loot you—
Because of human bloodshed and violence done to the land,
To the town and all its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who gets evil gain for his house
To put his nest on high,
To be delivered from the hand of calamity!
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Surely the stone will cry out from the wall,
And the rafter will answer it from the framework.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who builds a city with bloodshed
And founds a town with violence!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is it not indeed from the Lord of hosts
That peoples toil for fire,
And nations grow weary for nothing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For the earth will be filled
With the knowledge of the glory of the Lord,
As the waters cover the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to you who make your neighbors drink,
Who mix in your venom even to make them drunk
So as to look on their nakedness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You will be filled with disgrace rather than honor.
Now you yourself drink and expose your own nakedness.
The cup in the Lord’s right hand will come around to you,
And utter disgrace will come upon your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“For the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you,
And the devastation of its beasts by which you terrified them,
Because of human bloodshed and violence done to the land,
To the town and all its inhabitants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What profit is the idol when its maker has carved it,
Or an image, a teacher of falsehood?
For its maker trusts in his own handiwork
When he fashions speechless idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who says to a piece of wood, ‘Awake!’
To a mute stone, ‘Arise!’
And that is your teacher?
Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver,
And there is no breath at all inside it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But the Lord is in His holy temple.
Let all the earth be silent before Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, I have heard the report about You and I fear.
O Lord, revive Your work in the midst of the years,
In the midst of the years make it known;
In wrath remember mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God comes from Teman,
And the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah.
His splendor covers the heavens,
And the earth is full of His praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Before Him goes pestilence,
And plague comes after Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stood and surveyed the earth;
He looked and startled the nations.
Yes, the perpetual mountains were shattered,
The ancient hills collapsed.
His ways are everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I saw the tents of Cushan under distress,
The tent curtains of the land of Midian were trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did the Lord rage against the rivers,
Or was Your anger against the rivers,
Or was Your wrath against the sea,
That You rode on Your horses,
On Your chariots of salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your bow was made bare,
The rods of chastisement were sworn. Selah.
You cleaved the earth with rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains saw You and quaked;
The downpour of waters swept by.
The deep uttered forth its voice,
It lifted high its hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In indignation You marched through the earth;
In anger You trampled the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You went forth for the salvation of Your people,
For the salvation of Your anointed.
You struck the head of the house of the evil
To lay him open from thigh to neck. Selah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You pierced with his own spears
The head of his throngs.
They stormed in to scatter us;
Their exultation was like those
Who devour the oppressed in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You trampled on the sea with Your horses,
On the surge of many waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard and my inward parts trembled,
At the sound my lips quivered.
Decay enters my bones,
And in my place I tremble.
Because I must wait quietly for the day of distress,
For the people to arise who will invade us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the fig tree should not blossom
And there be no fruit on the vines,
Though the yield of the olive should fail
And the fields produce no food,
Though the flock should be cut off from the fold
And there be no cattle in the stalls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I will exult in the Lord,
I will rejoice in the God of my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord God is my strength,
And He has made my feet like hinds’ feet,
And makes me walk on my high places.
For the choir director, on my stringed instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
